page.title: 14SECONDARY REVIEW, CLITHEROE
page.content: In September 1985 Clitheroe's secondary schools will change. The two Grammar schools will gradually be joined together. Whilst the sixth form girls will eventually join with the sixth form boys at the Boys school all the pupils who passed the '11+' this year will come to the Girls school. Some people think that the amalgamation is a good idea but others do not. For instance a second year girl did not think this was a good idea as it did not apply to the whole school. But some first years thought it would be good to have a change. Everybody interviewed thought it was better to have the Girls Grammar School as the main site because the playing fields are near to the school. It was also thought they have better facilities although new buildings are having to be constructed.
